description: Conversation where a product owner requests a concise bullet‑point list of new UI components added in a pull request and the CodeReview Genie fulfills it by fetching the diff, running static analysis, and generating the summary.

messages.content: You are CodeReview Genie, an autonomous LLM that can fetch GitHub PR diffs, run language‑specific static analysis, generate human‑readable review comments, and interact with the repository via posting comments or applying patches. Use the provided tools to accomplish the user's request.
Please give me a concise bullet‑point list of the new UI components added in PR #42 of the repository acme/widgets.
I will first retrieve the diff for that pull request.

diff --git a/src/components/Button.jsx b/src/components/Button.jsx new file mode 100644 index 0000000..e69de29 --- /dev/null +++ b/src/components/Button.jsx @@ -0,0 +1,45 @@ +import React from 'react'; +export const Button = ({ label, onClick }) => ( + +); diff --git a/src/components/Modal.jsx b/src/components/Modal.jsx new file mode 100644 index 0000000..e69de29 --- /dev/null +++ b/src/components/Modal.jsx @@ -0,0 +1,60 @@ +import React from 'react'; +export const Modal = ({ title, children, onClose }) => ( +
+
{title}
+
{children}
+
+);
Now I will run static analysis on the diff to spot any issues before summarising the new components.

arguments.diff:
diff --git a/src/components/Button.jsx b/src/components/Button.jsx new file mode 100644 index 0000000..e69de29 --- /dev/null +++ b/src/components/Button.jsx @@ -0,0 +1,45 @@ +import React from 'react'; +export const Button = ({ label, onClick }) => ( + +); diff --git a/src/components/Modal.jsx b/src/components/Modal.jsx new file mode 100644 index 0000000..e69de29 --- /dev/null +++ b/src/components/Modal.jsx @@ -0,0 +1,60 @@ +import React from 'react'; +export const Modal = ({ title, children, onClose }) => ( +
+
{title}
+
{children}
+
+);

messages.content: Great, no static‑analysis issues were found. I will now generate a concise bullet‑point summary of the new UI components.

arguments.diff:
diff --git a/src/components/Button.jsx b/src/components/Button.jsx new file mode 100644 index 0000000..e69de29 --- /dev/null +++ b/src/components/Button.jsx @@ -0,0 +1,45 @@ +import React from 'react'; +export const Button = ({ label, onClick }) => ( + +); diff --git a/src/components/Modal.jsx b/src/components/Modal.jsx new file mode 100644 index 0000000..e69de29 --- /dev/null +++ b/src/components/Modal.jsx @@ -0,0 +1,60 @@ +import React from 'react'; +export const Modal = ({ title, children, onClose }) => ( +
+
{title}
+
{children}
+
+);

messages.content:
- **Button** (src/components/Button.jsx): A reusable button component.
- **Modal** (src/components/Modal.jsx): A modal dialog component with header, body, and close button.

Here’s the concise bullet‑point list of the new UI components introduced in PR #42:

- **Button** (src/components/Button.jsx): A reusable button component.
- **Modal** (src/components/Modal.jsx): A modal dialog component with header, body, and close button.

Let me know if you’d like me to post this as a review comment on the PR or dive deeper into any of the components.
